author: kcslb92
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

1. Download the latest PowerCLI Core packages from here: https://labs.vmware.com/flings/powercli-core
2. Extract zips into ~/.local/share/powershell/Modules/
3. Attempt to import the PowerCLI.* modules

```powershell
➜  Modules powershell
PowerShell v6.0.0-beta.3
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

PS /Users/kanecharles/.local/share/powershell/Modules> Get-Module -ListAvailable PowerCLI*


    Directory: /Users/kanecharles/.local/share/powershell/Modules


ModuleType Version    Name                                ExportedCommands
---------- -------    ----                                ----------------
Binary     6.0.0.0    PowerCLI.Cis
Binary     1.21       PowerCLI.Vds
Binary     1.21       PowerCLI.ViCore                     HookGetViewAutoCompleter


PS /Users/kanecharles/.local/share/powershell/Modules> Get-Module -ListAvailable PowerCLI* | Import-Module
Import-Module : The system cannot find the file specified.
 (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002)
At line:1 char:1
+ Get-Module -ListAvailable PowerCLI* | Import-Module
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [Import-Module], FileNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : FormatXmlUpdateException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
Modules should import successfully, as they had on an older version of Powershell Core.
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
PS /Users/kanecharles/.local/share/powershell/Modules> Get-Module -ListAvailable PowerCLI* | Import-Module
Import-Module : The system cannot find the file specified.
 (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002)
At line:1 char:1
+ Get-Module -ListAvailable PowerCLI* | Import-Module
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [Import-Module], FileNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : FormatXmlUpdateException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.3
OS                             Darwin 16.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 16.6.0: Fri Apr 14 16:21:16 PDT 2017; root:xnu-3789.60.24~6/RELEASE_X86_64
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @kanecharles92 Thanks for your report! Please move the report to #4062

comments.author: bredwrd
comments.body:
I have the exact same symptoms. Thank you for posting, since I'm new to using PowerShell on Mac and wasn't quite sure where to begin troubleshooting myself.

Based on the linked external issue, I've found that using the previous release of PowerShell [v6.0.0-beta.2](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v6.0.0-beta.2) allows the modules to be imported as expected. This may be a viable workaround until PowerShell is updated. 

Update: I have found a [different issue](https://labs.vmware.com/flings/powercli-core/bugs/461) connecting via `Connect-VIServer` on v6.0.0-beta.2, and it seems that the preferred version for VMware's PowerCLI Core is currently [v6.0.0-alpha.18](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v6.0.0-alpha.18).

comments.author: ollyhewett

Binary     1.21       PowerCLI.Vds

PS /root> Get-Module  -ListAvailable PowerCLI* | Import-Module
Import-Module : The system cannot find the file specified.
 (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002)
At line:1 char:1
+ Get-Module  -ListAvailable PowerCLI* | Import-Module
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [Import-Module], FileNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : FormatXmlUpdateException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Please test with Beta.4 (after 7/13) or build from the repo and test - I believe the Issue is already fixed.

comments.author: kcslb92
comments.body: @iSazonov where can I obtain the precompiled Beta.4 release? Thank you.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: It seems no nightly public builds exist yet. So only fork and build locally or wait 7/13.

comments.author: leonrado
comments.body: Same error here. some news ? I use beta.4

comments.author: ghost
comments.body:
beta5.  Is this the same error?

```
$PS /Users/msmith/.local/share/powershell/Modules> Get-Module -ListAvailable PowerCLI*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
    Directory: /Users/msmith/.local/share/powershell/Modules

Binary     1.21       PowerCLI.Vds                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
Binary     1.21       PowerCLI.ViCore                     HookGetViewAutoCompleter                                                                                                                                                                                                               

$PS /Users/msmith/.local/share/powershell/Modules> Get-Module -ListAvailable PowerCLI* | Import-Module                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              $Import-Module : Could not load file or assembly '/Users/msmith/.local/share/powershell/Modules/PowerCLI.ViCore/VMware.VimAutomation.Vds.Types'. The system cannot find the file specified.
At line:1 char:1
+ Get-Module -ListAvailable PowerCLI* | Import-Module
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [Import-Module], FileNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : FormatXmlUpdateException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand
 
$PS /Users/msmith/.local/share/powershell/Modules> ls -al PowerCLI.ViCore/*Vds.Types*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
-rw-r--r--@ 1 msmith  xxx  20992 Apr 10 06:46 PowerCLI.ViCore/VMware.VimAutomation.Vds.Types.dll
-rw-r--r--@ 1 msmith  xxx  48640 Apr 10 06:46 PowerCLI.ViCore/VMware.VimAutomation.Vds.Types.pdb
PS /Users/msmith/.local/share/powershell/Modules> 
```

comments.author: iSazonov

title: Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002 | Error when importing VMware's PowerCLI Core modules
